intro: Nassauvia chubutensis, commonly known as the Chubut thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
